H0.text: Elephantiasis is the disease characterized by extreme swelling of the limbs that is caused by infection with a type of roundworm.

H1.text: Pulmonary edema is the disease characterized by extreme swelling of the limbs caused by infection with a type of roundworm.

H2.text: Gigantism is a disease characterized by extreme swelling of the limbs caused by infection with a type of roundworm.

H3.text: Fibrosis is the disease characterized by extreme swelling of the limbs caused by infection with a type of roundworm.

A4.text: Elephantiasis tropica (known as lymphatic filariasis), caused by a number of parasitic worms, particularly Wuchereria bancrofti.
